sourcing.instructions: Al: Aluminum ingots from metal supply stores; C: Graphite powder from chemical suppliers; In: Indium pellets from online metal distributors; Sc: Scandium oxide from specialized rare earth suppliers.
steps: Al: Aluminum ingots from metal supply stores; C: Graphite powder from chemical suppliers; In: Indium pellets from online metal distributors; Sc: Scandium oxide from specialized rare earth suppliers.

1. Weigh out 215 g of aluminum, 54 g of graphite powder, 126 g of indium, and 204 g of scandium oxide using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the aluminum and graphite powder thoroughly using a mechanical mixer for 10 minutes to ensure uniform distribution. 3. Slowly add indium pellets and scandium oxide to the mixture and continue mixing for an additional 10 minutes.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 215 g of aluminum, 54 g of graphite powder, 126 g of indium, and 204 g of scandium oxide using a precision scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the aluminum and graphite powder thoroughly using a mechanical mixer for 10 minutes to ensure uniform distribution. 3. Slowly add indium pellets and scandium oxide to the mixture and continue mixing for an additional 10 minutes.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications. 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace to 800 °C (1472 °F) at a rate of 10 °C per minute. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to allow for complete reaction and alloy formation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powder into a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications. 2. Heat the crucible in a furnace to 800 °C (1472 °F) at a rate of 10 °C per minute. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to allow for complete reaction and alloy formation.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool gradually inside the furnace to room temperature. This should take approximately 4 hours for controlled cooling. 2. Once the temperature is below 100 °C, remove the crucible from the furnace.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool gradually inside the furnace to room temperature. This should take approximately 4 hours for controlled cooling. 2. Once the temperature is below 100 °C, remove the crucible from the furnace.

steps: 1. Carefully remove the solidified sample from the crucible. 2. Use a wet grinder to smooth the surfaces to achieve the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches). 3. Rinse the sample with distilled water to remove any residual powder, then dry it completely. 4. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance surface durability.
